body.name: Unscented Laundry Pods by AspenClean, New and Improved Packaging, Zero Plastic, EWG Verified™, Vegan, Hypoallergenic Natural Laundry Detergent - 36 Count

Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 8 hrs 55 mins

climatePledgeFriendly.details: Compact by Design (Certified by Amazon) products remove excess air and water, which reduces the carbon footprint of shipping and packaging. EWG Verified products are reviewed to ensure they are free from EWG’s known chemicals of concern and adhere to strict health standards.

features: Zero plastic: Our laundry pods are made of biodegradable, plant based ingredients that deliver a deep, powerful clean to your laundry. They are packaged in a 100% recycled paper container with NO plastic, while being fully compostable.

Tough on stains: Eco-friendly and tough on stains. Effective at removing dirt, grime, and grease but are baby-safe, pet-safe and gentle for sensitive skin. Treat tough stains while being safe on colors, delicate fabrics, and leave clothes feeling fresh!

No synthetic fragrance: Natural laundry detergent pods are entirely fragrance free and are carefully formulated with oxygen bleach and enzymes. We are proud to stand by the Aspen Clean way using NO synthetic fragrances, toxins, or irritants in our vegan laundry soap pods.

No harsh chemicals: Our plant based laundry detergent pods fight odor and remove tough stains without using harsh chemicals or toxins. Certified by EcoCert, the world's reference for organic home care, AspenClean guarantees environmental sustainability.

Ewg verified: Our laundry pods have earned an A-rating verification by the Environmental Working Group. ​​Our pods deliver the same results as conventional products but putting family and planet first.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Yes Yes YES!!!
reviews.reviewText: Wow. Where do I even start.I have tried a LOT of detergents. And most of the other laundry detergents I never could try because of the crazy strong fake flower smells.What I love:EWG rating. (Does not poison Aquatic life, does not cause cancer, does not cause reproductive harm, and no plastic.) ... I feel like all laundry should have these requirements but this is the only one I have found that actually cleans.Does not bug my nose when I open the container, when it is sudsing up the clothes for the water to clean them, when the clothes are in the dryer drying OR when I have them on my body. ( Note: Tide will have my throat titning at each of these stages and I am usually coughing over and over again because I am that sensitive.)Our sensitive skin family has never had a problom with this product. Even babies. I clean our cloth diapers with this soap and never have needed to strip them because the soup does not leave any buildup.And I love the pods after having to deep clean our previously used washer mechine due to liquid detergent being caked on it.(inside and out. It was so bad the clothes had a hard time getting clean due to the damage that detergent did to that mechine.)I always batch buy on black Friday as those are the best deals of the year. (20-30% off yes please)Amazon does free shipping so it is cheeper to buy on the site rather then the Aspen Clean website as they no longer offer my address free shipping.Down sides are 1: If I order from Amazon sometimes the pod rappers have devolved leaving the soap as non contained powder at the bottom of the container (assuming from a slight moisture problom in the warehouses .) But I have always just shaked the soap in the washer after using the full pods and it all works in the end. I am fine with this as I am saving money through buying from amazon.Downside 2: I find that I need to run laundry on warm water to get a really good clean. But I have also found that cleaning with warm water just cleans better in gAmazon.10 out of 10.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cleans well, laundry finally smells like NOTHING! :-). Scent doesn't stay
reviews.reviewText: Update: tried both the lavender and the eucalyptus scents. Neither scent lingers for very long at all. On one occasion, I did receive a shipment with broken pods, but that didn't bother me much. It seems when I order only detergent and nothing else from Amazon, the product ships straight from the factory and is fresh and in good shape. Otherwise, it might come from a warehouse somewhere and be older, hence the dried out pods? Who knows.***Overall, I am very happy with the performance of this laundry detergent.The pods arrived, shipped directly from Aspen Clean, in great condition. They were intact; nothing was broken.I used one pod per load in my compact front loading washing machine and added vinegar instead of softener. There was no residue from detergent powder when the cycle was through. The pods seemed to have dissolved completely.I bought the unscented variety. The laundry smells great: like NOTHING at all! Even cotton t-shirts that usually have some sort of musty smell after being laundered smelled like NOTHING. I had that problem for years with some Lands' End shirts: I would wash them, and they'd smell really weird, even though they hadn't been particularly soiled. That smell is finally gone, thank goodness.I have tried other "green" detergents before (liquid ones), but they typically would leave my clothes smelling "musty" and unpleasant. Aspen leaves them smelling clean, without scent.If you have problem stains like tomato sauce or marker, you will still want to pre-treat them. I use a plant based stain remover spray from my regional grocery store chain. Even so, a shadow of the tomato sauce remained on the item. Maybe soaking might do the trick.The laundry even seems to dry faster, if that's possible. I line dry, and the first load already started to feel dry when I was finished with the fourth load.I will definitely reorder this product and am happy with its performance.

reviews.reviewerName: Very modern and easy to assemble
reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I love the package with 0 plastic involved! Cleans well the clothes and lasts longer than others, I just use one pod per load unless I fill up the washer then I use two.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Does not dissolve
reviews.reviewText: I have mostly enjoyed using Aspen products, however, this one has been a bust. The pods do not dissolve in my HE washing machine. I tried it on different cycles with different water temperatures, but still, they do not dissolve. Disappointing. I will have to go back to their regular liquid product or try another brand.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great producf, but inconsistent package quality
reviews.reviewText: I do love this detergent for the health and environmental factors. EWG rated!It works well, clothes are clean, and no harmful/artificial smells.....but, I just received this months order and the pods are all dry and discolored, like yellowed plastic. And 90% of the pods were so dry they were split and all of the powder is loose. Similar to a few of the other reviews I've seen.I'm returning for a replacement, I'm still willing to give them more chances because i feel the product is worth it.Will update if I receive

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Baby Sensitive Skin
reviews.reviewText: I love that these are EWG verified and work great with my baby's sensitive skin, but I often have to use 2 pods for small loads of my baby's laundry. On a good day, his clothes smell unscented and "clean" which is the goal. On a bad day, his clothes still have a mildewy/residual smell, which I then have to rewash using tide detergent. Due to the high price and low-strength to deep clean I am only willing to use them on my baby's laundry for now.
